quote: I didn't expect to find you here.  I    thought you'd be down on the    Promenade, helping Mardah put up    decorations for the Bajoran Gratitude    Festival.
That was the plan... but it turns    out I don't have much to be grateful    for.
Isn't that the earring you...
Bought for Mardah.  Yeah, you want    it?  Maybe you could give it to Major    Kira for her next birthday or    something.
All right, tell me all about it.
Mardah's gone, Dad.  She got accepted    to the Science Academy on Regulus    Three.
That's a good school.
It's three hundred light years away.
Jake, you're sixteen; take my word    for it, you'll survive.
Now you can either wallow here in    self-pity, or go off to the Gratitude    Festival and try to have a good time.
Right now, I'd rather wallow.
You're entitled.  But remember, you're    a sweet, good-looking guy...       Just like your old man.
Sooner or later, you'll find someone    else.  Who knows... maybe you'll    meet someone tonight at the Festival.
Yeah, sure.
Jake, the whole point of the festival    is to put your troubles behind you    and make a new start.
I could use one.       Okay... I'll go.
(claps Jake on the     shoulder)   That's the spirit.
But I'm not going to have any fun.
Nervous, Chief?
What are you talking about?
That's your fifth cup of coffee in    twenty minutes.
I didn't know you were keeping track.
Ah, nervous and irascible.
Look if you hadn't seen your wife    and child for two months, you'd be    irascible, too.
Believe me, I'm looking forward to    Keiko and Molly's visit just as much    as you are.
I doubt that.
How many games of racquetball have    you and I played in the last two    months?
Oh, I don't know... fifteen, maybe    twenty.
Try seventy.  I've been keeping track    of that, too.  And you know what all    those games have proved to me?       That I'm a poor substitute for your    wife.

I could've told you that sixty games    ago.       The thing is... they're only going    to be here for two days.  That's    barely time to say hello.  And then    they're back to Bajor for four more    months.
Four months.  That's probably another    hundred and fifty games of    racquetball.  I don't know if my    elbow can take that kind of abuse.     Maybe you can convince her not to    leave.
Oh, no.  I can't do that.  I'm the    one who suggested she go on that    agrobiology expedition in the first    place.

We're just going to have to make the    best of the little time we have.       Which means we can't afford to waste    a second of the next two days.  And    Julian, whatever you do, don't tell    her how miserable I've been without    her.  I don't want her feeling guilty.
My lips are sealed.       So when are they getting here?
Twenty minutes.       I don't know about you, but I could    use another cup of coffee.
Peldor Joi, Odo.
Peldor Joi to you, too.  It's hard    to believe the Promenade is this    empty at midday.
Calm before the storm.  In a few    hours, this place will be packed    with Bajorans celebrating the    festival.
Actually, I was thinking I might    join you this year.
Really?

I don't see why not.  My Bajoran    deputies never work during the    Gratitude Festival; why should I?       Besides, if I'm going to live here    with you humanoids, I may as well    immerse myself in your rituals.
Who knows, you might even enjoy    yourself.
I suppose there is that possibility.
Maybe we'll see each other later.
I'd like that... if you're not too    busy being the Presider of the    Festival.
For you, I'll make time, Odo.
Just look for me.  I'll be with    Bareil.
Oh, I thought he'd be celebrating    the Festival on Bajor.
So did I... but I'm glad I was wrong.     He's coming in on the next shuttle.
Then you'd better go.  It'll be here    soon.
You're right.  I'll see you at the    festival.
Chief?
Major.
Keiko.
Bareil.
Good luck.
You, too.
Nerys.
I'm so glad to see you.
I've missed you.
I've missed you, too.
Miles?
Keiko...    (doesn't know what to     say)   I'm... so glad to see you.
I'm glad to see you, too.  I've just    had the worst trip.
Oh... I'm sorry to hear that.  But    now that you're here, everything's    going to be great.
Hi.
Hello, sweetie.  You ready to have a    good time with Daddy?
No.
Why not?
I don't feel so good.
Tell Daddy what's wrong.
Oh, you poor dear.
I never should've given you all that    candy.

I usually make it a point to stop by    Quark's three or four times a day at    random intervals... just to let him    know that I'm thinking about him.     But seeing that today's a holiday,    and he'll be busier than usual... I    suggest you station a man there full    time.
I think that about covers it.  If    you need me, I'll be on the    Promenade...
But don't call unless it's an    emergency.
The constable will be... occupied.
Madame Ambassador...
Do we have to be so formal?
Didn't they teach you any manners at    Starfleet Academy?
Come back in five minutes.
Make that half an hour.
So... what brings you to the station.
Officially I'm here as the Betazoid    representative to the Gratitude    Festival.  But the truth is, I came    to see you.  You poor sweet tortured    man.
Excuse me?
I know the torment you must be going    through.
To spend your whole life searching    for your people only to discover    that they're the leaders of that    awful Dominion.
You heard about that?
When you travel as much as I do, you    make friends everywhere.  I like to    think of Admiral Necheyev as the    sister I never had.       Don't worry, Odo.  I'm here to help    you.
What kind of help do you mean?
A sympathetic ear.  A shoulder to    cry on.       A lap to melt in.
That's very considerate of you, but    unnecessary.  My people are who they    are, and I am who I am... And I've    learned to accept that.
You brave soul.  Why don't we go    someplace quiet so you can tell me    all about it?
Actually, I was planning to go to    the opening of the Gratitude Festival    this afternoon.

Even better.  First, a little fun    and relaxation, and then we can delve    into the depths of your pain.       I'll freshen up, then I'll meet you    outside the Bajoran Temple for the    Presider's opening address.
I promise you, Odo, it's going to be    all right.  You're not alone anymore.
Level Twenty-three, Section Eight.
We need to see each other more often.
I know.  I wish we both weren't so    busy.  I never expected Kai Winn to    make me one of her principal advisors.
I think she just asks your advice so    she can do the opposite of whatever    you recommend.
I know you don't like Winn, Nerys...    but the office has changed her.  The    Prophets chose well.
So why not leave spiritual matters    in their capable hands and concentrate    on enjoying ourselves?
I have to go.
But the festival won't be starting    for another hour.
I have to set up the Renewal scrolls    along the Promenade.  It won't take    long.  Jadzia's promised to help.
Of course... Jadzia.       You know, I've never understood how    the two of you could be such good    friends.  She's... so unpredictable    and you're so...
Predictable?
I didn't mean it like that.       It's just that she gets to spend so    much more time with you than I do.
Jadzia and I have done this for the    past two years.  It's becoming kind    of a tradition.
I was hoping we could start some    traditions of our own...
And we will...    (she kisses him, then     breaks away)   Later tonight.
She asleep?
It looks like the medicine Doctor    Bashir prescribed is working...
That's a relief.
Rough trip, huh?
It was a disaster.
I'm glad you're home.
Me, too.
We should get ready for the festival.     The babysitter will be here any    minute.
The festival.
On the other hand, we could spend    the day locked away in our quarters.
What I really want to do is sleep.
Then maybe you should.
Miles, I didn't say I was going to    sleep; I just meant I could use some.
That's okay.  I mean... if you need    to sleep, go ahead.  I'll understand.
No, you won't.  You'll be disappointed    and you'll start brooding and stomping    around like an Andorian Bull.
Look, stay or go, it's all the same    to me... just tell me what you want    to do and we'll do it.
Miles, I've been making decisions    all day.  You decide.
Okay, we'll go to the festival.       But we don't have to go right away.     You can take some time to relax, and    change into something nice.
Nice?
You know... like your red dress.
My red dress?  Really?
Something wrong with the red dress?
If it'll make you happy, I'll wear    the red dress.
Forget the red dress.  Wear whatever    you want.
Look, let's just try to enjoy the    next two days.       I'll change into something nice and    we'll go to the festival.  Okay?
Fine.
I can hardly wait.
Tesra Peldor impatri bren.  Bentel    vetan ullon sten.
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: And now, I have the honor of placing    the first Renewal Scroll into the    fire.       As the scrolls burn, may all our    troubles turn to ashes with them.
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: Now, for the next twenty-six hours,    I expect you all to enjoy yourselves.     I know I will.
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: May the Prophets walk with us.
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: Jake, you okay?
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: Just felt a little funny there for a    second.
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: You sure you're all right?
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: Yeah, Dad.  Never felt better.
scene: 16   INT. PROMENADE - OUTSIDE THE BAJORAN SHRINE

quote: Bareil?
What are you looking for?
Nothing.  Just looking.
Peldor Joi.
Jake, how thoughtful.  Thank you.
Uh... I know you're busy, but can    I... talk to you for a second?
Sure.
In private?  It's kind of personal.
I'll be right back.
So what can I do for you, Jake?
I need some advice.  You see, there's    this older woman... and I think we're    perfect for each other.  But...
But she doesn't.
I'm not sure what she thinks.
Well, my advice is to tell Mardah how    you feel.  That way you'll know--
Mardah and I broke up.
You broke up?  Then who... ?
You.
Me?
I love you, Nerys.       Want to go out with me?
Morn, I can't believe a handsome,    fun-loving guy like you could have    so many problems.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: My advice is to burn this as quickly    as possible and don't look back.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: Sage advice.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: Vedek Bareil, it's good to see you.       If you're looking for Nerys, she's    not here.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: Actually, I was looking for you.       I owe you an apology.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: For what?
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: I have to confess, I've always been    a little jealous of your friendship    with Nerys.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: That's understandable.  When you    come to the station, you want her    all to yourself.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: You have such a wise, generous spirit.     I only wish I had a friend like you.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: I think of you as a friend.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: Do you mean that?
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: Of course.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: I'm glad.  Because I was hoping that    you and I could get to know each    other better.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: A lot better.
scene: 22   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE PROMENADE

quote: I love Bajoran music.  It's so    intelligent, so vital... It reminds    me of you.
Dance with me.
I'm sorry.  I don't dance.
Nonsense.  I saw you moving to the    music.
That wasn't dancing.  That was...    swaying.
Then sway with me, Odo.
I just remembered, I'm needed in    Security.
I'll come with you.
Hello, Lieutenant.  Having a good    time?
No.

That's right... genuine latinum-plated    Renewal Scroll inscription pens.     Blessed by Vedek Redab himself...    shortly before he passed away.  Each    pen is engraved with the words "Deep    Space Nine's Third Annual Gratitude    Festival," today's date, and a lovely    portrait of the station by Ermat    Zimm.       So get them while you can, they're    sure to become collector's items.
So what do you say we go walk around    the Promenade for a little while?
I'd rather stay here.       I never thought I'd say this, but I    kind of miss Quark's... the noise,    the excitement... our table.
You know, I haven't sat here since    you've been gone.
That's so sweet.
So how's the survey going?
The terrain's rougher than we    expected, and the ecosystem's a lot    more diverse than it looked from the    orbital scans.  All in all, it's    been pretty grueling.
Really?
Don't get me wrong, I'm having a    wonderful time.
Oh... that's good.
There is one problem I have to talk    to you about.       The project's taking longer than we    hoped.
What do you mean... longer?
You have to understand, Miles, every    valley has an entirely different    ecosystem.  There's a lot of work to    be done.
(wants the bottom     line)   How much longer is it going to take?
I'm not sure.
Take a guess.  An extra couple of    days... a week or two?
More like two or three months.
You're telling me you're going to be    on Bajor for another seven months.
It's either that or tell them to    find another botanist.
Maybe that's something worth    considering.
Are you asking me to resign?
No... But another seven months?
I don't like this any more than you    do.
You just said you're enjoying    yourself.
Oh, I'm sorry.  I suppose you'd be    happier if I was miserable?
I didn't say that.
Sebarr was right.  I never should've    mentioned it.
And who's Sebarr?
He's one of the zoologists I'm working    with.  He warned me not to talk to    you about this until after the    Gratitude Festival..
Who's he to be giving you advice?
He's a friend.
A friend?  I thought you were down    there working.
We are working.
With time out for intimate little    chats about our relationship?  What    else have you told him about us?
Miles, you're acting like a child.     What do you want me to say?
I want you to say you're not going    back... that you're going to stay    here with me.
Right now, Miles, I don't even want    to sit at the same table with you.
Fine.  Leave.  Go on back to Bajor...    and your plants... and Sebarr.
See if I care.
Whoa, slow down.
Hi, Dad.
I've been looking all over for you.     In case you've forgotten, we're    hosting a Gratitude Dinner tonight    in the wardroom, and I could use    your help getting ready.
I'm kind of busy right now, Dad.  I    have to find someone.
(that's what he was     afraid of)   Major Kira?
How did you know?
I just spoke to her.
Really?  Where is she?
Just hold on.
But I need to talk to her.  You know,    you were right about me meeting    someone at the Festival.
I didn't mean Major Kira.
You like her, don't you?
Of course I like her.
So do I.
Jake, what you're feeling... it's    just a crush.
Look, right now... you're confused,    hurt, vulnerable.  You miss Mardah...
Mardah was a mistake, Dad.  She was    too young, too immature for me.     Major Kira is a woman.
Major Kira is in love with Vedek    Bareil.
It won't last.  He's always on Bajor.     She needs someone who can be with    her all the time.  Like me.
Jake, I don't want to see you hurt    again.
I appreciate that, Dad... but this    is between Nerys and me.       Don't worry.  Everything's going to    be fine.
I really can't accept this.
But I want you to have it.  It's my    gift to you.
That's very thoughtful... but I have    nothing to give you in return.
Being with you is the only present I    need.       Now let's go write our Renewal    Scrolls.
Peldor Joi, Chief.       You look terrible.
Just a little headache, that's all.
Here... have a free pen.
What for?
To write down your problems on a    Renewal Scroll.
There isn't a scroll long enough to    hold all my problems.
Really?  I thought you could sum    them up with one word.       Keiko.
Tell me I'm wrong.       If you ask me, it's your own fault.     You never should've let her go to    Bajor in the first place.
And what was I supposed to do?  Force    her to stay here with me?
That would've been a good start.       You humans never learn.  You let    your women go out in public, hold    jobs, wear clothing, and you wonder    why your marriages fall apart.
That's your solution, Quark?  Treat    women like property?
Criticize it all you want.  But on    the Ferengi homeworld, husbands and    wives never argue.  There's no    divorce, no broken homes... nothing    but peaceful conjugal bliss.
If Ferengi marriages are so wonderful,    how come you're still single?
I haven't met the right woman yet.
Well I have.  And she just walked    out that door.
And out of your life.
Not if I can help it.
Bareil.  I was wondering where you    disappeared to.
Come on.  You can do better than    that.
(trying to hide his     discomfort)   Someone might see us.
We're the only people here.  Everyone    else is on the Promenade.
We have two hours until we're supposed    to join Commander Sisko for dinner.     That gives us some time to be alone    together.
I can't.
Why?
I have to find Jadzia.
Jadzia?  Is something wrong?
Not at all.       Have you seen her?
She's probably on the Promenade.
She wasn't there the last time I    looked.
Why is it so important for you to    talk to Jadzia?
I'll explain everything later.
Thank you, Nerys.
For what?
For being such a good friend.
Friend?
Dax, what are you doing here?
I thought you might need some help    getting ready for the party.
Thanks, but that's really not    necessary.  Wouldn't you rather be    celebrating on the Promenade?
No thank you.  I don't want to run    into Vedek Bareil.
Is there a problem between you two?
He can't keep his hands off me.
That doesn't sound like Vedek Bareil.
I couldn't believe it either, but    the man wouldn't leave me alone.     He's probably still out there looking    for me.
Have you told Kira?
I don't know how.  It's going to    break her heart.
Someone has to tell her.       You want me to do it?
Would you?
If you think that's the best way to    handle it.
I really appreciate this, Benjamin.     I mean, the whole thing's ridiculous.     How could I be interested in Bareil?
We both know it's always been you.
Dax?
Mmm?
What are you doing?
Making myself comfortable.
Have I ever told you that you smell    wonderful?
I have to admit, old man, you had me    going there for a minute.
Benjamin, you can stop acting so    coy.  No one's around.
I've got an idea.  Why don't you    cancel the party?  That way we can    spend the evening alone together.
What do you say?
Sisko to Bashir.
Go ahead, Commander.
Meet me in the Infirmary immediately.
I'll be right there.
Can I come, too?
Absolutely.
Her vital signs are normal... Brain    activity's normal... no sign of    infection or intoxication of any    kind...       She's the picture of health.
I told you.
Then why did you put your head in my    lap?
Julian, you should've seen his face.
Admit it, you were this far from    total panic.
I think we've both been victims of a    practical joke.

At least someone around here has a    sense of humor.       Remember the time Curzon convinced    you that the Romulan ambassador's    wife was in love with you?       This was even better.       See you at the party, Julian.
I've never been so embarrassed in my    life... making me sit through all    those tests...
It's your own fault, Dax.  You took    this one too far.
You know, if I didn't love you so    much, I'd be very angry with you    right now.
I'll see you at the party.
You look like you could use some    cheering up.
Do me a favor, Jake.
Anything.
Leave me alone.
Isn't she beautiful?
Hi, sweetie.  Feeling better?
Lots better.
Ah, that's what I wanted to hear.
Where's Mommy?
In her room.  She's sad.
Well why don't you play with Piggy    in your room for a while and we'll    see if Daddy can cheer Mommy up?
Okay.
Keiko?  It's me.  Can I come in?
Not now, Miles.

Look, you're right.  I'm an idiot,    sometimes.  When I don't get my way,    I can be selfish and childish and    pigheaded.  I know I've said some    pretty stupid things today.  I wish    I could take them back.       But even if it's too late for that,    there's one thing you should know...    I love you, Keiko.  I always have,    and I always will.       Anyway, I just want you to know I've    left a letter of resignation on    Commander Sisko's desk.  I'm ready    to move down to Bajor tomorrow, if    you'll have me.  And after that if    you want us to move back to Earth    that's okay too.  I'll do whatever    it takes... I just don't want to    lose you.       Honey, did you hear what I said?
Yes.
And... ?
And I need time to think.  Why don't    you go to Commander Sisko's party?     We can talk when you get back.
If that's what you want.
Major.  Aren't you headed in the    wrong direction?
Commander Sisko's party?
I'm not going.
Why ever not?
Because Bareil will be there.
I thought the two of you were very    happy together.
So did I.  But it turns out he'd    rather be with Dax than me.  And to    make things worse, Jake Sisko's    chasing me all over the station,    professing his undying love.

That's strange.  A little while ago,    Jadzia had Commander Sisko convinced    that she was in love with him.  He    even had me examine her to make sure    she was all right.  Apparently it    was only a joke.
Are you sure?  A lot of people are    acting strange today.
Maybe I'd better take another look    at Jadzia's test results.       Constable, could you tell Commander    Sisko I'll be a little late?
I should get to the Infirmary.
I'll join you.
Maybe you should examine Bareil and    Jake while you're at it.
That's not a bad idea.
This won't take long.
What is it, Odo?       I may not be able to read your    emotions, but I can read your    expression.  Something's wrong.
I'm fine.
I wish you'd tell me what's bothering    you.  It might make you feel better.
As soon as something bothers me,    I'll let you know.    (gives her a small     smile)   I promise.
Why is it I find stubborn men so    attractive?
Would you please stop following me?
Gladly... if you'll stop running    away.  I have something important to    discuss with you.
Discuss it with Kira.  I'm not    interested.
But I don't want to talk to Kira.
But Dad, you promised that Nerys    would be here.
She will be.  And stop calling her    Nerys.
Peldor Joi.
Commander, I didn't know you and    Lieutenant Dax were so close.
We're not.       Sisko to Bashir.
Computer, locate Doctor Bashir.
Doctor Bashir is in the Infirmary.
Constable, I want you to get him and    bring him here immediately.
I'll be right back.
I'll come with you.
(that's what he     expected)   Of course you will.
I wonder what Commander Sisko wanted?
It can wait.
This is very embarrassing.
I agree.  We have to stop.
Definitely.
Doctor...
Commander Sisko needs to see you in    the Wardroom.
Tell him...       I'll be along shortly.
Now, Doctor.
You'd better go.
Right.
Peldor Joi.
Please step aside, Commander.  I    need to talk to Jadzia in private.
I'm afraid she doesn't want to talk    to you.
You tell him, Benjamin.
But I only want to give her this.
A Bajoran betrothal bracelet?
Can I see that?
Nerys, am I glad to see you.
Doctor, I need your help.
I need yours too.
You've got to get me away from Kira.     I can't keep my hands off her.
And what's worse, I can't keep my    hands off him.
I can't explain it either.
She doesn't love me.
Who?
Nerys.
You're better off.  In the end, they    only break your heart.
Although sometimes it's worth it.
What do you think?
You look beautiful.
Miles, did you really hand in your    resignation?
You'd better get it back before    Commander Sisko sees it.       But it was nice of you to offer.
I love you so much.
Commander, here's that Idanian spice    pudding you ordered...
I want you to have this...    (she gives him the     betrothal bracelet)   As a token of my affection.
Oh, no you don't.
Bareil, listen to me...
If I have to fight for her I will.
I'm sorry, Benjamin, but he was really    starting to annoy me.
Commander... You throw one hell of a    party.
Pudding, anyone?
No thank you.
I'll take one.
Help yourself.
Are you okay?
Forget about him.  What about me?       I need you Keiko.  My lobes tingle    at the sight of you...       Marry me.
She's taken, Quark...
Easy, Chief.  He doesn't know what    he's doing.
What are you looking at me for?
Zanthi Fever?  But that's impossible.     It only effects... older Betazoids.

That may be, but according to my    tests, you're showing all the    symptoms.       Zanthi Fever is a virus that effects    the empathic abilities of... mature    Betazoids.  It causes them to project    their own emotions onto others.
So then Mrs. Troi's amorous feelings    for...       ... someone on the station were being    passed along to the people around    her.
Not everyone.  Only people who were    in close proximity to her when she    had an attack.  And even then there    would have to have been a pre-existing    latent attraction.
You're saying Dax... ?
Only on a subconscious level.       Best not to think about it too much,    if you ask me.
Commander, I'm so sorry.  I hope I    haven't caused you too much trouble.
I doubt there was any permanent harm    done.       Right, Doctor?
A simple wide spectrum antiviral    agent should cure Mrs. Troi, and as    for everyone else... they should    return to normal in a day or two.
Now if you'll excuse me, I promised    I'd meet Nerys in her quarters.
I think you ought to postpone that    visit.  For a day or two.

Commander's log, supplemental.  I'm    happy to report that Doctor Bashir's    diagnosis has been proven correct.     My son and all the other's affected    by Mrs. Troi's condition have made    full recoveries.
scene: 54   EXT. SPACE - DEEP SPACE NINE -  STOCK (OPTICAL)

quote: Well, this is one Gratitude Festival    they'll be talking about for a long    time.
I know I'll never forget it.
I hope everything works out for you,    Odo.       With Major Kira.
I don't know what you mean.
